{{Infobox film | name = 6 Balloons | image = 6 Balloons poster.jpg | alt = | caption = Official poster | director = [[Marja-Lewis Ryan]] | producer = {{Plainlist| * [[Reid Carolin]] * Ross M. Dinerstein * Samantha Housman * Peter Kiernan * [[Channing Tatum]] }} | writer = Marja-Lewis Ryan | starring = {{Plainlist| * [[Abbi Jacobson]] * [[Dave Franco]] * Charlotte Carel * Madeline Carel * Dawan Owens * Jen Tullock * [[Maya Erskine]] * [[Tim Matheson]] * [[Jane Kaczmarek]] }}<!---DO NOT change per poster billing block---> | music = Heather McIntosh | cinematography = [[Polly Morgan (cinematographer)|Polly Morgan]] | editing = Brian Scofield | studio = {{Plainlist| * Campfire * Free Association }} | distributor = [[Netflix]] | released = {{Film date|2018|3|12|[[South by Southwest|SXSW]]|2018|4|6|United States}} | runtime = 74 minutes<ref>{{cite web|url=https://schedule.sxsw.com/2018/films/121879|title=6 Balloons|work=SXSW Schedule|publisher=[[South by Southwest]]|accessdate=January 31, 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180201075809/https://schedule.sxsw.com/2018/films/121879|archive-date=February 1, 2018|url-status=dead|df=mdy-all}}</ref> | country = United States | language = English | budget = | gross = }}
'''''6 Balloons''''' is a 2018 American [[drama film]] written and directed by [[Marja-Lewis Ryan]] and starring [[Abbi Jacobson]], [[Dave Franco]], Charlotte Carel, Madeline Carel, Dawan Owens, Jen Tullock, [[Maya Erskine]], [[Tim Matheson]] and [[Jane Kaczmarek]].
The film had its world premiere at [[South by Southwest]] on March 12, 2018. It was released on April 6, 2018, by [[Netflix]].
==Plot== Katie ([[Abbi Jacobson]]) is preparing a surprise birthday party for her boyfriend Jack (Dawan Owens). While setting the celebration up, she exhibits Type-A quirks and consistently attempts to keep things on schedule. As her mother Gayle ([[Jane Kaczmarek]]) and her friends continue to set-up, Katie goes to pick up the cake and stops to pick up her brother Seth ([[Dave Franco]]) and his young daughter Ella along the way. After observing his unopened mail, Katie suspects that Seth has relapsed in his heroin addiction.
Katie drives around town trying to find a detox center after Seth's previous one denies his insurance. Soon after sending Seth to a downtown detox center in a taxi and returning to the party with Ella, Katie receives a call that Seth is unable to be admitted. Katie finds Seth in a sickly state and continues to search for a center throughout the Los Angeles area, missing Jack's arrival to the surprise party. Seth pleads with Katie to buy heroin for him for pain relief. In a homeless area, Katie finds heroin for Seth, which is packaged in six balloons. Katie returns to the car and Seth asks her to go back and buy a needle from a man living under a tarp. Katie says no. So he begs her to go to a pharmacy.
At the drug store, the pharmacist realizes that Seth is a heroin user and gives Katie the key to the bathroom where she changes Ella’s diaper, asking Seth not to use very much before Seth shoots up. Seth becomes revitalized and the three depart. Before leaving Seth hands Katie the key to the bathroom and laughs about her having to bring it back to the now closed Pharmacy. After Katie gets into an argument with the pharmacist and throws the bathroom key at the pharmacy door setting off the alarm, she runs back to the vehicle and before leaving the pharmacy backs into a light pole. While returning to the party, Katie jokes with Seth and they retrieve the cake. Seth promises that his latest injection is his final use of heroin.
Back at the party, Katie's parents and Jack realize Seth is under the influence given his giddy behavior. They confront Katie over the night's events and she assumes guilt. Seth leaves Ella in the back yard while he leaves to use, leaving Ella to look for him. After family confronts Katie about Seth using, she finds Seth, who is injecting again in her car, and tells him that she will no longer take care of him, insisting that the only way for him to kick his addiction is for himself to check-in to rehabilitation without her help.
Katie, no longer burdened, steps out of the car into a night sky filled with fireworks.
==Cast== * [[Abbi Jacobson]] as Katie, Seth’s sister, Jack’s girlfriend and Gayle’s daughter * [[Dave Franco]] as Seth, Katie’s brother and Gayle’s son * [[Tim Matheson]] as Gary * [[Jane Kaczmarek]] as Gayle, Seth and Katie’s mother * [[Maya Erskine]] as Cameron * Dawan Owens as Jack, Katie’s boyfriend * Jen Tullock as Bianca
==Production== In October 2016, Abbi Jacobson, Dave Franco, Tim Matheson, and Jane Kaczmarek joined the cast of the film, while Marja-Lewis Ryan will direct the film from the screenplay she wrote.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.indiewire.com/2016/10/broad-city-netflix-6-balloons-abbi-jacobson-dave-franco-jane-kaczmarek-tim-matheson-1201735520/|title=Abbi Jacobson, Dave Franco and Jane Kaczmarek to Star in Netflix Heroin Drama ‘6 Balloons’|website=[[Deadline Hollywood]]|publisher=[[Penske Business Media]]|first=Casey|last=Coit|date=October 11, 2016|accessdate=October 11, 2016}}</ref> Samantha Housman, Ross Dinerstein, [[Channing Tatum]], [[Reid Carolin]] and Peter Kiernan will produce the film under their Campfire and Free Association banners respectively.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://deadline.com/2016/10/netflix-6-balloons-abbi-jacobson-dave-franco-jane-kaczmarek-tim-matheson-heroin-epidemic-1201834576/|title=Netflix Sets ‘Broad City’s Abbi Jacobson & Dave Franco For Heroin Drama ‘6 Balloons’|website=[[Deadline Hollywood]]|publisher=[[Penske Business Media]]|first=Mike Jr.|last=Fleming|date=October 11, 2016|accessdate=October 27, 2016}}</ref>
[[Principal photography]] began in October 2016.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://onset-hollywood.com/6-balloons-2017-filming-locations/|title=6 Balloons Movie Filming Locations|website=On Set Hollywood|author=Jenna|date=October 12, 2016|accessdate=October 27, 2016}}</ref>
==Release== The film had its world premiere at [[South by Southwest]] on March 12, 2018.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/sxsw-emily-blunts-a-quiet-place-open-fest-1080335|title=SXSW: Emily Blunt's 'A Quiet Place' to Open Fest|website=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|publisher=[[Prometheus Global Media]]|first=Mia|last=Galuppo|date=January 31, 2018|accessdate=January 31, 2018}}</ref> It was released on April 6, 2018.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.netflix.com/gy/title/80130625|title=6 Balloons|publisher=[[Netflix]]|accessdate=March 12, 2018}}</ref>
===Critical reception=== On [[review aggregator]] website [[Rotten Tomatoes]], the film holds an approval rating of 86% based on 29 reviews, and an [[average rating]] of 6.6/10. The website's critical consensus reads, "Delicately sketched but thematically rich, ''6 Balloons'' rises on Abbi Jacobson's gripping performance -- and marks writer-director Marja-Lewis Ryan as a talent to watch."<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/6_balloons |title=6 Balloons (2018) |work=[[Rotten Tomatoes]] |publisher=[[Fandango (company)|Fandango Media]] |accessdate=May 9, 2018}}</ref> On [[Metacritic]], the film has a weighted average score of 66 out of 100, based on 7 critics, indicating "generally favorable reviews".<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.metacritic.com/movie/6-balloons |title=6 Balloons Reviews |work=[[Metacritic]] |publisher=[[CBS Interactive]] |accessdate=April 9, 2018}}</ref>
